reviewText:
Etaria is OK!
I was expecting more of a terraria feel, With a AI Village system, Unfortunately not the feel.
However it can still be fun, Its a very chill / Casual game. Cant say i would play it often enough, but i can already see the devs are in development of new stuff :)
Also, The Graphics are very very retro / 8 bit can barely make out what some things / Words are To Be Honest :/ Just one of very few negatives.

EDIT: I found a negative.... Player Progression was wiped when the game updated, Hopefully this doesnt happen every update... And it seems WWAAAYYY to easy to progress, but at the moment there isnt much to progress to.... Levels are Easy to get, and buildings are easy to make.

ALSO, The devs have published an Android and iOS version... So they wont be solely Steam dedicated like most Developers Unfortunately. ( On that note, if you want to try the game before you buy... Search for Etaria Lite" in the App Store."
voteText: 34 of 47 people (72%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: Cute little game and cheap imo, You choose a race (But it looks like the other races are being worked on, though this is not early access i hope they will be added) So far there's only human you can pick. Then you spawn in a randomly generated infinite world of sidescrolling propertions with caves you can explore aswell. I only played a little bit but enjoyed what i've seen so far, i slaughtered wolves, giant snakes, giant spiders, ghosts, bunnies, sheeps, ((Don't think of killing a squirrel with an axe, they hide in trees). You chop down trees, collect rocks, minerals, food, then you build your own village. I only built one house so far but i created a villager by using the bed inside the house. You can even store items in chests inside houses it's really neat. I stored spider legs, wolf skins, wool and items i have no idea how to use yet. I recommend this game if you like a casual gameplay and relax, but also explore at the same time. Got level 5 and died, looks like death=permadeath so it's really survival, watch out in those caves!

reviewText:
Really worth the time, money, and fun :D
The game can be pretty confusing at first look, but it takes only a few minutes to start realizing things and go on!
Really recommend the game and hoping for lots of updates :D

The game also still needs some end game features, like more weapons and armor, maybe different minerals, little bosses, or even rare monsters, also the Gold coin drop rate must be nerfed, as it makes lot easier to be just killing monsters, sell everything, and buy the materials (and op sword) from the Store :)

Another point is about the Drill that I still have no idea on what to do with it (if it makes something, some tip/add on tutorial would be nice :D

Its a really nice survival game,
Best of luck! ♥

reviewText: For what you pay for, this isn't a bad game, that being said you are getting about what you pay for.\n\nEtaria is more of an exploration game with village sandbox mechanics. The world is infinitre and generated as you play, but divided into sections. I am reluctant to call it an actual platformer, you mostly just go left or right, you can jump but there's no platforms" to jump to. It feels very similar to Zelda II on the NES when you go into random world map battles. Each section is one of multiple biome types
voteText: and desert seem to be the most common though there may be others. Each section has a "level range" for enemies showing you how powerful the enemies in that area are
helpfulPercent: and they progressively get more powerful the further from where you start.\n\nThe goals of the game are not well defined
votesHelpful: there doesn't appear to be a set objective except to create a village
votesTotal: you can ignore this to some extent but progression is tied into having a village. The village building system is very basic
votesFunny: you start by defining which section you want to be your village
column16: and then walls are placed up around it. After that you can use resources you've found like logs
column19: and food to add to stores you build which add to the village resources and let you build more buildings. Each house you build adds one villager and you can define jobs for them by building special homes for that job. The jobs appear to be Soldier
column25: with Forge & Shop automatically coming with their own merchants.\n\nAs you kill enemies and collect resources from the world you will gain XP and level up
column26: each level up lets you increase one of 3 stats
column29: and health pool. You can sell various items you collect at a shop to buy new weapons and armor. Combat is extremely simple
column30: you just hit the LMB and you swing in the direction you are facing
column31: and most enemies will just attack you directly
column32: Spiders appear to be the worst because they will sometimes jump at you making them the most likely culprit of killing you. The game appears to be permadeath as you will lose your save game when you die.\n\nAll in all it's not a bad game by any means but it feels low on content
column33: the randomly generated world is only interesting up until you've seen every biome
column34: after which one desert looks the same as any other. The UI is pretty basic but not very intuitive
column35: it's simple once you learn it but it definitely feels like a mobile port (which I think it is). So if you just want to play a simple little sidescrolling village sandbox game check it out
column37: but don't expect it to give you days and weeks worth of content to explore."

reviewText:
Game is not worth the price and the Game is ok but it is extremely frustrating. For example its a nightmare to turn around, fighting is slow and difficult, meaning that an enemy like a spider can hit you then jump straight over you and you wont get a single hit another example is hunting you hit something and it runs right past you and by the time you turn the ♥♥♥♥ around you've lost it!
they really need to work on player movement meaning that you should be able to turn without pushing a button but when you look somewhere with the mouse he turns that would be very usefull. game overall is a 7/10 because i died like 4 times purely because of this issue. Please fix this turning crap.

reviewText: Don't get me wrong it's not that bad a game. It's just that with all the other games out there even on a similar this game is just not that captivating. I found myself forcing myself to play it, not actually wanting to. Slow progress and little to do. It's a cute world that is novel at first, but overtime get repetitive and boring. Also I find everything being in super large size annoying.\n\nIt is a niche game which has it's unique quirks but it is no fun for playing.

reviewText:
So far it is a fun little time filler for when I am waiting for a friend to finish their matches in other games or when I need to fill in 5-10 here and there. The weapons and armours are well designed (for the size of the pixels) and the villages are quite fun to construct making your little bald men work as miners or hunters getting all dressed up in their little costumes getting completely rekt when they are a soldier having to face a wolf or six.

The game could do with a little tweaking here and there as well as some more content but overall it is quite good for what you pay.

EDIT: Dear Diary, today I became a Demon Lightning wizard and set out on a quest to kill anything that looks at me funny. Kill total so far: 117

reviewText: This is a fun survival game that I believe you should pick up if you like indie, survival games because of it's extemely low price. I think that the devs should think about adding a hunger bar or another essential aswell as a night time. for £0.79/ $1\nit's 9/10, I also haven't experienced any bugs except for your backpack to stay on screen once you've exited your inventory, but it's easily fixible if you exit and re-enter your world.
